locations.title: Savers - Manchester
locations.description:
Savers is a chain of for-profit thrift stores accepting and reselling donated items from non-profit organizations. They also work with waste management companies for responsible disposal of items that cannot be recycled.

They accept a wide range of donations including garments, accessories, shoes, sports equipment, textiles, appliances, toys, games, houseware, jewelry, media, small furniture, and more.
locations.address: 93 S Maple St, Manchester, NH 03103, USA

locations.title: Salvation Army - Antrim
locations.description:
The Salvation Army was founded in London in 1865. Since then it has grown into a global charitable organization, currently serving in 130 countries.

Financial donations are more than welcome, but they also accept goods such as clothing, houseware, home appliances, furniture, and others. If you're not sure whether they can accept your donation, please give them a call beforehand.

locations.title: Planet Aid - Homestead Grocery and Deli
locations.description:
Planet Aid is a non-profit organization that focuses on collecting, recycling, and redistributing donated clothing and shoes to promote environmental sustainability and support global development. Through strategically placed donation bins in communities, they provide an accessible way for people to contribute their unwanted textiles. Once collected, the items are sorted and either resold in secondhand markets or recycled, helping to reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills. The proceeds from the sale of donated items are channeled into various educational, health, and environmental initiatives, particularly in underdeveloped regions.

Planet Aid’s efforts extend beyond environmental goals. Their programs help improve access to education, promote sustainable farming practices, and combat poverty in some of the world's poorest communities. By reusing and recycling clothing, Planet Aid reduces textile waste while simultaneously creating positive social impact, making their model an important link between environmental care and global development.
locations.address: 432 Boston Post Rd, Amherst, NH 03031, USA

Through strategically placed donation bins in communities, they provide an accessible way for people to contribute their unwanted textiles. Once collected, the items are sorted and either resold in secondhand markets or recycled, helping to reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills. The proceeds from the sale of donated items are channeled into various educational, health, and environmental initiatives, particularly in underdeveloped regions.

Planet Aid’s efforts extend beyond environmental goals. Their programs help improve access to education, promote sustainable farming practices, and combat poverty in some of the world's poorest communities. By reusing and recycling clothing, Planet Aid reduces textile waste while simultaneously creating positive social impact, making their model an important link between environmental care and global development.

Planet Aid is a non-profit organization that focuses on collecting, recycling, and redistributing donated clothing and shoes to promote environmental sustainability and support global development. Through strategically placed donation bins in communities, they provide an accessible way for people to contribute their unwanted textiles. Once collected, the items are sorted and either resold in secondhand markets or recycled, helping to reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills. The proceeds from the sale of donated items are channeled into various educational, health, and environmental initiatives, particularly in underdeveloped regions.

Planet Aid’s efforts extend beyond environmental goals. Their programs help improve access to education, promote sustainable farming practices, and combat poverty in some of the world's poorest communities. By reusing and recycling clothing, Planet Aid reduces textile waste while simultaneously creating positive social impact, making their model an important link between environmental care and global development.
